definition: (separated only by) a narrow strip of water
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
clothes/CL:件[jian4]/Kangxi radical 145
to dress/to wear/to put on (clothes)
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: "Neighbors separated only by a strip of water." This expression has been employed for a long time to describe the diplomatic communication and the friendship between China and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 一衣带水一直被用来形容中日两国之间的邦交与友谊。

sentences.english: Japan and china are close neighbours separated by only a strip of water.
sentences.chinese: 中日两国一衣带水，隋唐以前，两国已有文化交往。

sentences.english: China and Japan are close neighbours separated only by a strip of water.
sentences.chinese: 中国和日本是一衣带水的近邻。

sentences.english: As the neighbors connected by waters, both countries have witnessed a long history of friendly exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 作为一衣带水的邻国，两国友好交往历史悠久。

sentences.english: Who will win a war between Vietnam and China?
sentences.chinese: 中国和越南是一衣带水的亚洲邻邦。

sentences.english: China and Japan are close neighbors facing each other across a narrow strip of water.
sentences.chinese: 中日两国是一衣带水的邻邦。

definition: close neighbor
to look at one another/to face each other
to border on
bilateral/both shores/both sides/both coasts/Taiwan and mainland
neighbor/next-door neighbor/near/next to
lit. source is distant and the flow is long (idiom); fig. sth goes back to the dim and distant past/a lot of water has flowed under the bridge since then
descendants of the Fiery Emperor and the Yellow Emperor (i.e. Han Chinese people)
blood is thicker than water/fig. family ties are closer than social relations
good relations
geographic situation/geo-(politics etc)
to be located at/to be situated in
far apart
illustrious hero, spirit of the place (idiom); a place derives reflected glory from an illustrious son
cultural tradition
traceable to the same stock (idiom); of a common origin (of trends, ideas etc)
